Comment 3: 
Graham King has started updating the gdb docs in https://golang.org/cl/69870049
(currently unmailed, I don't know why).

While building a pure Go debugger sounds fun, there may be other alternatives worth
investigating.

Here's a straw man, to which I've given very little thought. According to
http://lldb.llvm.org/python-reference.html, "LLDB has all of its core code build into a
shared library which gets used by the lldb command line application. [...] LLDB also
provides an lldb.py module that contains the bindings from LLDB into Python." We could
write Go bindings for that shared library, which would let us drive LLDB from Go.
